project.name: NodeToolkit
project.description: A place for modules shared across services

params.name: key
params.description: Public key for the field, to be manipulated through the APIs.

props.name: path
props.description: Internal path of the field (might be different than the exposed/public `key`).

props.name: isRequired
props.description:
Is the field required ? If `true`, `isWritable` will also be
automatically set to true to stay consistent.

props.name: isReadable
props.description: Defines whether or not the field can be read/selected.

props.name: isWritable
props.description: Defines whether or not the field can be written.

props.name: isFilterable
props.description:
Defines whether or not the field can be filtered/sorted. If `true`,
`isReadable` will also be set to `true` to stay consistent.

props.name: isWritableOnce
props.description:
Defines whether or not the field can be updated once written. Be
careful that setting this prop to `true` will also set `isWritable` and `isRequired` to true in order to force the
first write.

props.name: ISOFormat
props.description: ISO format to validate values against.

props.name: maxSize
props.description: In bytes, the maximal size the file can have

props.name: minLength
props.description: Minimal length for the field to be valid.

props.name: maxLength
props.description: Maximal length for the field to be valid.

props.name: pattern
props.description: Field must match pattern to be valid.

props.name: app
props.description: The express application on which the routes will be attached

Restypie.Methods.name: Restypie.Methods
Restypie.Methods.description: List of symbols representing HTTP methods.

params.name: context
params.description: An object containing the objects the route needs to access to.

Restypie.RoutesSorter.name: Restypie.RoutesSorter
Restypie.RoutesSorter.description:
Exposes a single `sort` method that sorts a given routes list to avoid any conflicts.

**Example**

Let's say you declare the two following _Route1_ and _Route2_ on your express app :

```javascript
let routes = [
  { method: 'get', path: '/users' }, // Route1
  { method: 'get', path: '/users/:id' } // Route2
];
```

_Route2_ will never be reached, because its pattern will first match _Route1_. Let's do some magic :

```
RoutesSorter.sort(routes);
```

The `routes` array will now look like :

```
[
  { method: 'get', path: '/users/:id' },
  { method: 'get', path: '/users' }
]
```


TODO explain how sorting works

classitems.description:
Defines whether or not creating multiple objects at a time is allowed. If setting this property to `true`, the
target resource must implement the `createObjects` method.
classitems.name: allowsMany

classitems.description: Checks whether or not the field is present, meaning not `null`, nor `undefined`.
classitems.name: isPresent

classitems.description:
Validates that `value` `isPresent()`.

**Throws:**
- `Restypie.TemplateErrors.Missing`: If the field is required but `null` of `undefined`.
classitems.name: validatePresence

classitems.description: Validates `value` and provides a list of validation errors.
classitems.name: validate

classitems.description: Returns the supported operator that corresponds to `operatorName`, if any.
classitems.name: getOperatorByName

classitems.description: Turns `"null"` and `"undefined"` into `null` and `undefined`, otherwise lets `value` untouched.
classitems.name: toJavascriptValue

classitems.description:
Validates that `value` fulfills the `options` requirements, such as `min`, ...

**Throws:**
- `Restypie.TemplateErrors.OutOfRange`: If `value` is not within `min` and `max`
classitems.name: validate

classitems.description:
Casts `value` into a Boolean.

**Throws:**
- `Restypie.TemplateErrors.BadType`: If 'value' is not `true`, `false`, `"true"` or `"false"`.
classitems.name: hydrate

classitems.description:
Turns `value` into a `Date` if it's either a `Date`, an ISO formatted string or a timestamp.

**Throws:**
- `Restypie.TemplateErrors.BadType`: If `value` cannot be converted to an ISO date.
classitems.name: hydrate

classitems.description:
Makes sure that the date is within the range.

**Throws:**
- `Restypie.TemplateErrors.OutOfRange`: If `value` is not in the valid dates range.
classitems.name: validate

classitems.description: Renders `value` as an ISO datetime string.
classitems.name: dehydrate

classitems.description:
Used by the default class to write on the file system. By default returns a path in the tmp directory. Override
this method to save the file in a different directory.
classitems.name: buildFilePath

classitems.description: Creates a write stream to pipe the file. This method must attach the `path` property to `file`.
classitems.name: writeStream

classitems.description: Removes the file from its storage.
classitems.name: unlink

classitems.description:
Validates that `file.size` does not exceed `maxSize`.

**Throws:**
- `Restypie.TemplateErrors.OutOfRange:` If the file is too big.

Casts `value` into an integer if it represents any positive or negative float.

**Throws:**
- `Restypie.TemplateErrors.BadType`: If `value` cannot be casted.
classitems.name: hydrate

classitems.description:
Casts `value` into an integer if it represents any positive or negative integer. Only pure integers are valid,
floats are not.

**Throws:**
- `Restypie.TemplateErrors.BadType`: If `value` cannot be casted.
classitems.name: hydrate

classitems.description:
Casts `value` into a `String` if its type is `String` or `Number`.

**Throws:**
- `Restypie.TemplateErrors.BadType`: If 'value' is not a `String` or a `Number`.
classitems.name: hydrate

classitems.description:
Validates that `value` fulfills the `options` requirements, such as `minLength`, ...

**Throws:**
- `Restypie.TemplateErrors.OutOfRange`: If 'value' is not within `minLength` and `maxLength`.
- `Restypie.TemplateErrors.BadPattern`: If 'value' doesn't match `pattern`.

Tries to find a match given a string (ie "int" => Integer), a primitive constructor. If `type` is an AbstractField
subclass, it is returned directly.

**Throws:**
`TypeError`: If no match can be found
classitems.name: match

classitems.description: Shortcut to get the resource's primary key field.
classitems.name: primaryKeyField

classitems.description:
Checks that `Route` is a valid subclass and instantiate it with the right context.

**Throws:**
- `TypeError`: If `route` is not an instance of `Restypie.Route`
classitems.name: _createRoute

classitems.description:
Instantiates the routes.

**Throws:**
- `TypeError`: If one of the parameters is not an instance of `Restypie.Route`
classitems.name: _createRoutes

classitems.name: supportedFormatMimeTypesAndAliases

classitems.name: supportsUniqueConstraints

classitems.description: Fields to be selected by default. By default select all readable fields.

classitems.name: fieldPathToKey

classitems.description: Computes and returns the full url for this resource on its host.
classitems.name: getFullUrl

classitems.description: Responsible of fetching a **single** object from the storage. This method **must** resolve with an object.
classitems.name: getObject

classitems.description: Responsible of fetching a **several** objects from the storage. This method **must** resolve with an array.
classitems.name: getObjects

classitems.description: Responsible of updating a **single** object in the storage.

classitems.description: Responsible of deleting a **single** object from the storage.
classitems.name: deleteObject

classitems.description: Responsible of replacing a **single** object in the storage.
classitems.name: replaceObject

classitems.description: Builds a comprehensive object to describe the resource's capabilities and schema.
classitems.name: getSchemaDescription

classitems.description:
Looks into `resource.serializers` to find a serializer that corresponds to `type`. If none is found, `null` is
returned.

Decide which strategy to adopt to parse the body and fulfills `bundle.body`. Will reject with a 415 if the
content type cannot be negotiated.

For now supports :
- "multipart/form-data" : for file uploads and fields
- "application/json" : `req.body` is assumed to be filled, not additional parsing is made
classitems.name: parseBody

classitems.description:
Sets `bundle.limit` either from the query string or using `resource.defaultLimit`.

**Throws:**

- `Restypie.TemplateErrors.BadType`: If `limit` has been provided in the query string but could not be casted
to a valid integer
- `Restypie.TemplateErrors.OutOfRange`: If the requested limit exceeds `resource.maxLimit` or is lower than 1
classitems.name: parseLimit

classitems.description:
Sets `bundle.offset` from the query string. Defaults to 0.

**Throws:**

- `Restypie.TemplateErrors.BadType`: If `offset` has been provided in the query string but could not be casted
to a valid integer
- `Restypie.TemplateErrors.OutOfRange`: If the requested offset is lower than 0
classitems.name: parseOffset

classitems.description: Parses fields to be sorted. Defaults to `defaultSort`.
classitems.name: parseSort

classitems.description:
Sets `bundle.format` either from the query string of the `Accept` header, the query string having the precedence.

**Throws:**
- `Restypie.TemplateErrors.UnsupportedFormat`: If no corresponding serializer is found.
Parses fields to be selected. Returns `defaultSelect` if none.
classitems.name: parseSelect

classitems.description: Transforms each keys and values into their internal version.
classitems.name: hydrate

classitems.description:
Formats `bundle.data` before it is delivered. For security reasons, only fields that are `isSelectable` are
returned.
Populates properties of the objects in `bundle.data` by requesting the associated resources.
classitems.name: populate

return.description: FIXME this function is way too complex !

classitems.description:
Serializes `bundle.payload` according to `bundle.format`, assuming that the format is valid and has been parsed
by `resource.parseFormat`.
classitems.name: serialize

classitems.description:
Sends the final response.

- Extracts the status code from `bundle.statusCode`
- Extracts the headers code from `bundle.headers`
- Extracts the response body code from `bundle.payload`
classitems.name: respond

classitems.description:
Parses files and fields from a multipart request. The files field names must match an existing `FileField` in the
schema. If no match is found, the file is not written and the method rejects. If a file size exceeds the `maxSize`
defined in the field, the request is rejected and the started upload rolled back in the storage.
classitems.name: _parseMultipart

classitems.description: Ensure that the returned value is a `Restypie.RestErrors.AbstractRestError`. Defaults to an InternalServerError.
classitems.name: toRestError

classitems.name: path

classitems.description: The express application on which the routes will be attached
classitems.name: app

classitems.description:
Launches the API.

**IMPORTANT** : this method can only be called once
classitems.name: launch

classitems.description:
Sort an array of routes to avoid conflicts.

**IMPORTANT** This method affects the original array.

classitems.name: BadPattern

classitems.description:
Checks whether or not `Child` is a subclass of `Parent`.

**Throws:**
- `TypeError`: If `Child` is not a subclass of `Parent` and `shouldThrow` is set to `true`
classitems.name: isSubclassOf

classitems.description:
Checks whether or not `obj` is an instance of `Constructor`.

**Throws:**
- `TypeError`: If `obj` is not an instance of `Constructor` and `shouldThrow` is set to `true`.
classitems.name: isInstanceOf

classitems.description: To be used in an abstract class constructor. Will throw if the class is instantiated.
classitems.name: forceAbstract

classitems.description: Forces the class and its subclasses to be static (not instantiable).
classitems.name: forceStatic

classitems.description: Returns `true` if `value` is `null` or `undefined`. Returns `false` for any other value.
classitems.name: isNone
example:
```javascript
Utils.isNone(); // true
Utils.isNone(null); // true
Utils.isNone(undefined); // true
Utils.isNone(NaN); // false
Utils.isNone(''); // false
Utils.isNone(0); // false
Utils.isNone(false); // false
Utils.isNone([]); // false
Utils.isNone({}); // false
```

classitems.description: Checks whether or not `value` is a valid number as well as not `NaN`.
classitems.name: isValidNumber
example:
```javascript
Utils.isValidNumber(3); // true
Utils.isValidNumber(3.2); // true
Utils.isValidNumber('3'); // false
Utils.isValidNumber(NaN); // false
```

classitems.description: Checks whether of not `obj` is returning a promise.
classitems.name: didReturnAPromise

classitems.description: Builds a new class containing all `mixins` and allows inheritance.
classitems.name: mix
